name: Shadow Lurker
desc:
It stands at a relatively diminutive height, barely reaching five feet, with hunched, spindly limbs covered 
in coarse, ebony tendrils reminiscent of shadowy vines. Its eyes are dull, lifeless orbs, lacking malevolence, 
and its form maintains a rudimentary, humanoid shape. It moves with a skulking gait, seemingly bound to servitude in an eerie realm.

name: Lurker
desc:
It stands at a relatively diminutive height, barely reaching five feet, with hunched, spindly limbs covered 
in coarse, ebony tendrils reminiscent of shadowy vines. Its eyes are dull, lifeless orbs, lacking malevolence, 
and its form maintains a rudimentary, humanoid shape. It moves with a skulking gait, seemingly bound to servitude in an eerie realm.

name: Lurkstar
desc:
This creature resembles a unique blend of an ant-eater and a starfish. Its furry, star-shaped body features 
tentacle-like appendages, which it uses to feed on small creatures and plants by sucking them in. It's also 
equipped with a lightning-fast, prehensile tongue that can lunge forward with remarkable speed.

name: Human Grotesquerie
desc:
A humanoid mutation, once ordinary colonists, now embody the twisted horrors of the Lurkers' influence, standing 
grotesquely distorted and malevolently driven to infect and expand their nightmarish legion.

name: Animal Grotesquerie
desc:
A repulsive dog-like creature, a grotesque hybrid of a mangy coyote and a porcupine, exudes a putrid odor of 
offal and carrion. It charges forward, revealing a mouthful of human-like teeth, and attempts to 
tackle with its multi-foot-long spines, even launching quills from a distance.

name: Cavern Miner
desc:
A grotesque subterranean dweller, this creature from an alien planet combines crustacean and arachnid features. 
Standing at about four feet tall on spindly, multi-jointed legs, 
it boasts an elongated, bioluminescent chitinous exoskeleton.

name: Stellarscreech
desc:
An alien bat-like creature found in the planet's caves, flaunts an impressive wingspan within the dark tunnels. 
Its membranous wings shimmer with an unearthly iridescence, complemented by midnight-blue fur and bioluminescent patterns.
